sourceNotes: Editorial guidance prepared by Pitchchat; not sourced from user submissions.
title: Blockchain Seed fundraising metrics benchmarks
summary: Seed-stage blockchain metrics focus on organic usage and sustainable economics. Post-crypto winter, investors heavily discount vanity metrics and incentivized activity. These benchmarks emphasize real utility and economic sustainability over speculative growth. Pitchchat keeps fundraising metrics investor-ready in one room.

metrics.label: Weekly Active Wallets
metrics.note: Unique wallets with meaningful activity weekly. Filter out bots and wash trading. Quality matters more than quantity.

metrics.label: Monthly Transaction Volume
metrics.note: Real transaction volume through the protocol. Organic volume preferred over incentivized activity.

metrics.label: Total Value Locked
metrics.note: For DeFi protocols. Focus on organic TVL without unsustainable incentives. Stability matters as much as size.

metrics.label: Protocol Revenue
metrics.note: Fee revenue generated by the protocol. The key metric for sustainable economics. Growing trajectory important.

metrics.label: User Retention (30-day)
metrics.note: Users returning after 30 days. Crypto retention is challengingâ€”show improvement trajectory.

metrics.label: Smart Contract Audits
metrics.note: Audits from recognized security firms. All critical and high findings must be addressed.

metrics.label: Developer Contributors
metrics.note: Active contributors to protocol development. Shows development velocity and community health.

metrics.label: Community Size
metrics.note: Community engagement across platforms. Quality of engagement matters more than follower count.

metrics.label: Capital Raised
metrics.note: Seed rounds vary significantly. Include any token pre-sales or grants in total capital picture.

metrics.label: Team Size
metrics.note: Core team including developers, community, and business. Heavy on technical talent typically.
